our_candidate.name: Tim Brennan
our_candidate.background: Three-term Senator, former autoworker, union leader, working-class champion, Cleveland native, Irish-American

opponent.name: Jim Stanton
opponent.background: Car dealership owner, businessman, Trump-aligned, first-time candidate, self-funder, Lima native

demographics.economic_profile: Manufacturing decline, post-industrial anxiety, automotive industry concerns, opioid crisis impact, cost of living pressures, brain drain to other states

notes: CRITICAL LOSS. Trump coattails in presidential year, combined with economic messaging failure, produced 6.2-point loss for three-term incumbent. Focus groups showed warning signs: working-class defection in Youngstown, suburban slippage in Cleveland, Columbus couldn't compensate. Economic attacks landed and were not adequately countered. Cultural disconnect with rural Ohio growing. Lessons essential for Ohio 2026 challenger strategy.
